articles.title: Half of fish tested in an Amazon river have unsafe levels of mercury
articles.description: At four locations close to the Yanomami Indigenous reserve in Brazil, many species of fish were found to have mercury levels considered unsafe for consumption
articles.content:
By Luke Taylor
Fish is a major part of the diet for Yanomami people
Pulsar Imagens/Alamy
Mercury pollution from illegal mining in the Brazilian Amazon means that many species of fish that people d… [+340 chars]

articles.title: Whale songs can spread between groups nearly 8000 kilometres apart
articles.description: Songs that were first heard from humpback whales off eastern Australia were picked up in whales off Ecuador several years later, suggesting that the noises passed between groups across the south Pacific Ocean
articles.content:
By Alex Wilkins
A humpback whale (Megaptera novaeangliae) in the Pacific Ocean off the island Rurutu in French Polynesia
imageBROKER / Alamy

articles.title: Compression socks may prevent nausea and loose bowels during marathons
articles.description: Stomach cramps and the urgent need for the toilet on long runs may partly be caused by decreased blood flow damaging gut cells. Compression socks reduce signs of this damage in marathon runners
articles.content:
By Grace Wade
Wearing compression socks during a marathon may help prevent damage to gut cells
sportpoint/Alamy
Wearing compression socks may reduce the intestinal damage thought to cause cramping… [+443 chars]

articles.title: Fungi evolved their weird and wild shapes in two big bursts
articles.description: The vast array of shapes that fungi can take, including colourful mushroom caps and tangles of thread-like moulds, evolved in two big bursts hundreds of millions of years ago
articles.content:
By Jake Buehler
Dasyscyphella nivea, a cup fungus that belongs to the sac-bearing group

articles.title: Superheated steam dishwasher could kill bacteria in just 25 seconds
articles.description: Computer simulations of a simplified dishwasher that uses hot, dry steam and no detergent found that it could kill all heat-resistant bacteria on a plate in under half a minute – but it might not actually clean your dishes
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
Superhot steam could kill bacteria without soap
Shutterstock/samray
A superheated steam dishwasher could kill heat-resistant bacteria on a plate in less than 30 second… [+2125 chars]

articles.title: JWST reveals young star that may be about to give birth to a planet
articles.description: Spectral information from the James Webb Space Telescope has unveiled chemicals inside a protostar that hint it is in the process of forming planets
articles.content:
By Alex Wilkins
The James Webb telescope is making discovery after discovery
Vadim Sadovski/Shutterstock

articles.title: Deadly Pakistan floods are a climate catastrophe, says UN chief
articles.description: Eight weeks of torrential rain during a severe monsoon season have left a third of Pakistan underwater, in the worst flooding since 2010

A road damaged by flood waters following heavy monsoon rains in Madian, Pakistan

articles.title: Immortal jellyfish genes identified that may explain their long lives
articles.description: By performing a DNA comparison of two similar jellyfish species, researchers have found the genes that could stop and reverse ageing in immortal jellyfish
articles.content:

One jellyfish’s regeneration powers seem linked to key genetic changes.

articles.title: Soy-heavy vegan diet may reduce hot flushes in postmenopausal women
articles.description: Following a low-fat vegan diet along with eating 86 grams of soybeans daily reduced the frequency of hot flushes by 78 per cent in postmenopausal women
